alert.note: Alert for Middle Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 08 at 3:02PM AKDT until June 09 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THURSDAY FOR HOT DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR THE MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY NORTH OF THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER... * Winds...North to northeast winds 15 mph possible this afternoon and evening. Winds will subside Wednesday night and increase Thursday afternoon to 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 25 mph possible through Thursday evening. Higher winds likely over mountainous terrain. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. RH will recover overnight tonight to 65 to 80 percent and drop Thursday afternoon to as low as 15 percent. * Temperatures...Low to mid 70s. * Timing...Hot and dry conditions are likely Wednesday afternoon, but winds may only reach 15 mph over higher terrain. Hot, dry, and windy conditions are most likely Thursday afternoon and evening. * Location...Middle Kuskokwim Valley north of the Kuskokwim River. * Impacts...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are imminent or occurring now, or will shortly. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them to the public. -CJ
